author: ivankwananda
title: AMA with Cross-Chain Communities
description: There are many chains, but they build their own chain independently. We need to increase communication, coordination & collaboration between chains in Indonesia, so that we could learn from each other

f6_assessments.q0: To start with, this proposal title already gives good description on what the proposal is about, basically running AMA with other cross-chain communities, specifically in Indonesia. And this proposal will outreach other chain communities via online event to share knowledge between communities. Furthermore, the key metrics of the proposal is aligned with the challenge setting metrics that is increasing the number of events/workshops arranged with other communities. By having these AMAs, it will bring awareness about Cardano to the other chain communities, and it will further drive adoption/collaboration through exploration and ideas from the community in the future. In brief, I think this proposal will be a good starting point for Indonesian Cardano community to explore ideas from other chain communities. Overall, I give 5 stars for the impact.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of experience, based on the proposer background, I think that the proposer is quite active within Cardano community, especially in Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall. In addition, Ivan is also Ambassador for Moonbeam Indonesia and advocate for Chainlink Indonesia. Therefore, in my opinion he is quite capable to host event and bridge different chain communities altogether in AMA. On top of that, the budget is broken quite well into smaller detail, plus the total budget is quite reasonable (USD 3420) to host 3 AMAs online via Zoom. The proposal provides also good timeline, where they host 1 AMA / month with different communities (such as: Harmony, Cosmos and Polkadot). I believe that the team (Ivan & Stevani) supported by Cardano Indonesia Community could run the AMA successfully if funded. Taking everything into consideration, I give 5 stars for the feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: We live in an age where most of the thing could be checked online. The proposer provided Cardano Meetup link (https://www.meetup.com/Cardano-Blockchain-Jakarta/) where they will post the event to the communities. Moreover, they also provide GitHub link and YouTube, where they will post the Zoom recording so people could rewatch it again. In addition, the proposal also gives good key metrics & goals such as holding 3 successful AMA in 3 months, that could be measured via Meetup/YouTube. The roadmap is achievable within the timeline and the proposer specifically know how to contact the other chain communities. Nevertheless, it would be great if the proposer could give more detail about what topic that they would like to bring up during AMA in the roadmap. In conclusion, I give 5 stars for the auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: The author of the proposal realizes, that there are many chains, but they build their own chains independently. There is a need to strengthen communication, coordination and collaboration between chains in Indonesia so that everyone can learn from each other. In terms of geographical location, Indonesia belongs to the Continent: Asia, with a population of 274.1 million people (in 2020). Ranked 4th in the world and 3rd in Asia. More than 53% of the population uses the internet. This is a favorable condition for relationship building, awareness and understanding among the communities of the chain in Indonesia, to learn from each other and inspire each other. The proposed impact on the challenge was posed and described in great detail and richness. The proponent will hold three AMAs with crypto communities and cross-chain communities in Indonesia (once a month, for 3 months). The author provides many cross-chain websites and the Blockchain community. The AMA and the Indonesian cross-chain community will help people better understand the Cardano community and what the team has been up to. Besides, the author of the proposal also recognizes the possible risks. At the same time, there are solutions to minimize risks when the proposal is implemented.
f6_assessments.q1: The author of the proposal says that If funded, the AMA will be held for 3 months (September to November 2022). Right after that, the author provides key indicators and goals; and Rundown AMA ~ 120 minutes. And the Proposal's Plan is laid out with a clear roadmap divided into 3 months and organized by milestones. And is provided with full links of websites and community channels. We know what will be done in the 3 month period of the project. Next is the budget. The author proposed a budget of $3,420 for the project. This is a fairly low budget for the workflow and the time it takes to do the project. In my opinion, the team needs to propose more budget to ensure the progress and success of the project is feasible and sustainable over time. About the requested budget. The author has provided a very detailed budget table. The budgets are broken down, and allocated to each very specific job, estimated hourly, for each specific job. Finally, about the team of proposed team members. We learned that Ivan Kwananda Pangestu is Eastern Hemisphere City Hall Team Member, Community Developer and network developer at Indonesian blockchain communities...Stevani Ongko is also Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall Team Member. ... We are about the identity, role and skills of each member and have attached links so we can learn more about them. The proposal has a very workable plan, clear roadmap, transparent budget and skilled team members to execute the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a plan to successfully implement the project in a transparent manner. Detailed step-by-step roadmap and budget analysis for easy audits and successful project progress. Although it is a completely new proposal, it has demonstrated the experience and expertise of the team, increasing the sustainable strength of the project. The proposal team provided us with multiple ways to track and measure project progress. Organized 3 AMAs with 3 Indonesian community chains in 3 months; Posted at GitHub Cardano Indonesia; The meeting is tracked, via the Link: Cardano MeetUp; and upload the AMA to the Cardano Indonesia Youtube Channel. That means we can track how the project will develop in many ways, and we know what value it will bring to the community. And the final product is what is expected, the success of this project. Since we have been given a lot of information, I believe it is complete and satisfactory has been established. The proposal has good auditability and transparency.

f6_assessments.q0: In essence, the proposer plan to manage three sharing sessions between Harmony, Polkadot, Near, and Cosmos community. It aligns well with the challenge's main objectives: "find common ground and share knowledge, resources, skills, ideas and visions.” It is a shame that the proposer has not decided what materials to share and whom the session speaker is because the effectiveness of AMA depends heavily on the factor mentioned above. That being said, I think the further discussion takes time, and it's understandable that the detailed topics have not been provided. Overall, I strongly agree with the idea and will join the session if it is funded. It is an exciting first step toward cross-chain collaboration in Indonesia and avoiding the echo chamber phenomenon.
f6_assessments.q1:
Feasibility tends to be on the agreeable side. The proposer has listed their profiles and is involved in Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall, especially Ivan, who seems to be actively involved in many blockchain communities.

The budget requested has been broken down into items. However, I found the last item (Operational & Miscellaneous) to be redundant. The marketing materials should be included in the promotion designer item and there seems to be no need for stationery; the proposer could take notes using their laptop.

Another thing, albeit small, I think the proposer needs to address the challenge of engaging with the listeners. Put it this way; if I were to join a sharing event about a blockchain technology I am not familiar with, I would be confused and feel disengaged, right? There are alternatives to deal with this problem, of course, by providing early handouts about the material before the event starts or simply sharing beginner topics during the session. But, again, I am sure the proposer has a way to deal with this; I want to see it being addressed in the proposal.

Overall, I tend to agree with the feasibility, some aspects could be improved, but based on the roadmap and the implementation outline, I foresee no major obstacles.
f6_assessments.q2: There seems to be no problem with auditability. The proposer target to successfully host three sharing sessions within three months. It is also straightforward to track those sessions because of the links provided. However, I would like the cross-chain collaborative efforts to bear fruits, maybe in the form of a consolidated chat group between those chains. Another form would be speaker notes, publicly available so everyone from all communities could see how the transfer of knowledge went. In the end, I have no significant problem with the metrics that the proposer is putting up, and I am confident the progress could easily be tracked.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has described the team's proposed solution is hosting 3 AMA with crypto communities and cross-chain communities in the area of Indonesia. The frequency is once a month and they host 3 AMA so the project will last in 3 months. The writer has said that there would be material delivery and Q&A session in each AMA. The proposal was written well in the part of describing how the solution will address the challenge since it has displayed that the AMAs will be the opportunities for people to learn and share many things about different chains, build mutual understanding and relationship between chains and communities in Indonesia. About risks, they have mentioned the possible risks and how they would solve them.
f6_assessments.q1: The writer has showed that the plan will take place in 3 months from September to November 2022. They provided the roadmap for the whole plan including what they target to in each month. The proposal also included how long each AMA would last, which is 2 hours. They also explained what they would do in each AMA. The budget breakdown was displayed so detailed and the information of team members was showed clearly for people to follow. Only one thing I found confused is that they described how success would look like and the key metrics in this part. I think they should have included those things in the impact part.
f6_assessments.q2: The writer has said that they would post report and videos of the AMAs on Youtube for people to keep track of their activities. But I think it would be better if they had showed the certain criteria which they would use to regard if they had reached the target or not. For example the number of people joining in the AMAs. About what success look like, they have mentioned generally.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer described clearly about the objective and the proposed solution, and from impact perspective, the proposal would give a great impact to not only the Cardano community, but also to other chain communities (especially in Indonesia) by building good relationship through collaboration. The proposer also mentions the project’s success indicator and key metrics, which are important to create a good project structure. The proposer knows the risks and how to mitigate them, and already planned for future projects. I believe that this project would grow and give impact in international scale in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer provides good summary about their experiences, completed with LinkedIn profiles. The proposer is an active member in Cardano Indonesia Community who has experiences as community builder and has connections to various Indonesia blockchain communities, and by working with another member experienced in promotion design will show a great promise in this project’s quality and success. This proposal has a clear roadmap (completed with community to collaborate with), AMA rundown, and budget breakdown with details for each aspect. For clarity, providing a short description about each point would give more details. I do not understand what collaboration fees are for, if the budget for speakers and coordinator are already provided. Overall, this proposal provides good information about the project and team behind it.
f6_assessments.q2: As stated above, this proposal is provided with a clear roadmap, including the target community to collaborate with, complete with their channel. The proposal also provides links to watch the project, through Cardano MeetUp, Cardano Indonesia GitHub and YouTube Channel. However, there are no clear metrics to measure the project’s success. The proposer only stated the amount of AMA hosted in 3 months as the goal. Recording the participant number and their responses to the project after each session would give a clear success metrics and providing suggestions for upcoming projects.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would try to bring up collaboration on each community and chain, resulting in a more versatile, vastly-developing solutions and collaboration, adding immense value to the every single network working to support each other in a positive manner. The proposers have a clear plan to implement the objective of the proposal by trying to bring the people to collaborate, as the core of the network itself, through AMA, with approaching some cross-chain communities. Not only trying to solve the Cross-collaboration Challenge, this project specifically mentioned the development of Cardano knowledge and network in Indonesia, resulting in bigger impact and development of ADA in Southeast Asia.

The project doesn’t have a significant risk, mentioning only connection trouble and price being over, with each of them has its own plan of mitigation. The proposers is even open to price bargaining for the project, the project is not very costly.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is a clear planned rundown of the proposed AMA in the proposal. The timeline is also quite clear, as the proposers wanted to held AMA for 3 times in 3 months through Sep-Nov 2022, with each AMA held in 2 hours. The proposal has even provided the detailed plan of community channel they will collaborate with in each month, making the plan is even clearer.

Budget breakdown has been done very concise and detailed. It has also included every technical and minor event cost details in its account. Even that the project will be run by just 2 people, their included background records and Linkedin information has already enough to say that they can hold the event perfectly. The event is even being supported by Cardano indonesia Community, making it even more feasible with its huge supporting community.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditable measurement has been explained concisely in the proposal, which is successfully held 3 AMA with 3 Communities as proposed. They also will post their report at GitHub page and upload the recordings at Cardano Indonesia youtube channel, which makes the project completely traceable. Publish launch date has also been provided as they mentioned to have successfully carried out 3 AMA from September 2022, so we could account their progress and check on respective accounts/reference by the defined time.

f6_assessments.q0: In Indonesia itself, it is true that there is still a lack of knowledge about the Cardano ecosystem and the cross-chain community in Indonesia. To connect the Indonesian cross-chain community, it is hoped that this event can educate and publicize many people who do not know what the Cardano ecosystem and cross-chain community are. If this proposal is successful and continues onwards, this will greatly help the Indonesian cross-chain community to connect and continue to grow. I will definitely attend this event because, to be honest, I’m still lacking knowledge about this it would be a shame if we missed an opportunity like this.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal maker has listed provides evidence (references, links, etc.) of the people who will work on the event. the budget is very clear and well detailed so that it can be easily understood, maybe additional funds can be added just in case when AMA hosting is usually always overtime.and maybe can they add more manpower i think they lack of manpower
f6_assessments.q2: they explain clearly what will be done and the goal is very clear to help the chain community to connect with each other in AMA. as well the name AMA(Ask Me Anything) they also publish openly via youtube and github link to track the progress of their event work properly. and each chain community also helps with publications not only from youtube and github links. this program will be held 3 month and the timeline is understandable.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal bring up the problem about the lack of coordination and communication between Cardano and other blockchain communitites in Indonesia. It addresses this challenge by building a collaborative community between different blockchains in Indonesia to build relationship and share knowledge via AMA events (workshops and Q&A). The goals of introducing and connecting Cardano to/with other communities in Indonesia through these AMA events also aligned with the challenge settings of collaborating with other chain communities. Overall, I think this is a solid idea that identifies the issues well and has a clear goal on how the solutions are going to be implemented. By having these events, it will bring more awareness towards the Cardano Indonesia community of other blockchains out there and it can bring out new ideas from the community in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provided a well thought out plan on how to run these events and is backed by relevant links of proposer’s relevant skills and experiences needed to implement said events, such as community development. The budget has been laid out in details (hours, number of people involved, operational cost, etc.) which shows that the proposer has identified the type and number of people involved, as well as the resources needed. Being provided a clear and laid out 3 months roadmap with clear goals and key milestones (regarding the implementation of the 3 monthly AMA events), this proposal looks feasible to be completed in a timely manner. I would have preferred if they have also included specific details of what kind of speakers and topics will be brought up during these events. Because there are no further details regarding these issue, it’s hard to judge whether the events will be well structured or not. My suggestion is to provide additional information regarding the topics of the events and how the speakers will be chosen (i.e. the experiences needed, etc). Additional funding required needed to hold future events with other communities can be judged by the success of this proposal. In regards of risk and mitigation, there were mentions of the risk of event logistics (e.g. platform problems) and cost, as well as the proposer’s plan to mitigate these risks, however, there were no mentions of the risk of people not coming to the events due to low interests. This is the risk the proposer might have overlooked as I don’t see any explanation regarding this issue.
f6_assessments.q2: The target set is to hold 3 AMA events with 3 communities. The project can be tracked easily since the events will be made public on the MeetUp platform. However, there lacks an indicator of measuring how well received these events are by the community, The indicators used can be feedbacks given by the participants in terms of score regarding how helpful the event content is, how interesting the talk is, etc. It seems like this indicator might have been overlooked since there were no explanations about it.

solution:
To build relationship, raise awareness & understanding between chains' communities in Indonesia
To learn from each other chain and inspire one another, so that we can pick good ideas to implement
experience: I am a community builder & networking person. I am involve & networking with many big telegram communities in Indonesia and I also have cross-chain network with Harmony, Polkadot, Chainlink, Moonbeam, AAG Ventures and many more. I am good in communication & relationship building.
